H0.text: Rapidly boiling a liquid to make it thicker and more concentrated is called what. Evaporate

H1.text: Rapidly boiling a liquid to make it thicker and more concentrated is called what. Concentrate

H2.text: Rapidly boiling a liquid to make it thicker and more concentrated is called what. Boil Down

H3.text: Rapidly boiling a liquid to make it thicker and more concentrated is called what. Reduce

A4.text: The use of evaporation to dry or concentrate samples is a common preparatory step for many laboratory analyses such as spectroscopy and chromatography.

A5.text: When the vapor pressure reaches the ambient pressure the liquid will boil.
